Thank you for posting this.... as much as I want to have a more personal connection with people here, I realize how that pre-disposes OP's to VERY bad advice and people who are suffering are often in an altered state that DOES NOT benefit others.

That's why I try to only reply to posts when I'm up and only make posts when I'm down (don't try to look for them I use multiple accounts and delete old posts and so should you guys for the sake of not being discriminated against for your problems, which are normal and sometimes feel extreme and can make the general public react to you irrationally because they don't understand).

Love you guys so much, I wish everyone as much happiness as possible, especially coming up on the holidays.
I think I broke this rule more than once in the past..I'm sorry guys I will think more before leaving a comment.

I agree "pm me anytime" is useless, imo if someone was that concerned, drop them a message not with a "I'm here to help message me anytime" but ask them what's up, people don't want to ask for help, especially in cases like this where someone's depression might feel silly even though it's not, I'm not sure on how much harm would come of it but possibly just being direct and making the person talk about it, starting with the concerning person might possibly be the way to do it

Here’s my story and experience with this- I posted on SW a long time ago and was targeted by a much older man (I was an 18 y/o girl) preying on vulnerable women. He offered to PM me and abused that. He first emotionally distanced me from my friends in the real world so I only relied on him for support. This is how he was able to make me codependent on him and would put up with other things so he could get what he wanted. 

He convinced me I had a serious mental illness so I questioned my sanity so when he made stepped over a boundary I was just being “crazy”. He worked for the NCA. He told me he could “find me easily”. He got my personal details. I was terrified one day he would turn up at my house. 

A couple of other things happened, I eventually went to his work and had to give a statement. I’m pretty sure he lost his job for talking to me at work and abusing his power to manipulate a mentally ill teenager. I had to sit in a room with a bunch of two way mirrors and hidden cameras and talk about everything. They screened my laptop. I don’t know if my video was used in court I kind of left it all behind after that. 

But anyway. All this came from one PM. You should never trust a random stranger not everyone is just looking out for you and wants to talk.

Had posted something here and someone PM’d me offering cbd oils for my depression. 

Glad my depression can help someone earn money /s
ahh shit.

Unfortunately, I have a tendency to play the savior for other people whilst neglecting my own issues.

I always think about this story about a woman that was dead for two years in her apartment before her remains were found. This is how I imagine the end of my life will be. I’ll die alone, with no one missing a beat.
So disable comments completely? I don't understand how this can be avoided accurately.

Please refresh your memory as often as you need to - the rules are always posted right there in the sidebar ("community info" on mobile), and we'll ensure the wiki stays highly visible as well.

Edit: I'm also concerned that you might not have understood the post, actually, if the general idea of "offering private contact as a first resort here leaves many people with depression feeling worse or at higher risk for abuse and/or suicide, even when done with the best of intentions" is hard to remember. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the wiki page clearer.

> I feel that forced positivity has a worse effect on me than sad posts.

You're not alone, and this topic is one of the info wikis we're working on.

Yeah I agree. I don’t mind when people at least try but when they immediately send you a PM and say "was upppp" I immediately decline because I don’t want to deal with someone who clearly doesn’t get it. Especially when they ask "what’s wrong, why are you depressed", then why the hell did you lurk around on here and send me a private message then? It’s so fucked up.

We made the wiki and this post to make people aware of the potential consequences of getting into private conversations because we know those consequences are hard to foresee.  

We don't mean to "paint" anyone, but although there are definitely predators out there, most of the people who offer private contact have nothing but friendly good intentions, but they don't have the information needed to understand the risks and downsides of getting into private conversations too early.  That's not their fault.

Yep. 

The worst part is that most people who contact me directly are stupid bs advertisers or someone who’s just lurking and has no clue what depression is. I’ve made sure to report these people more, I don’t want to come of as a dick but they’re obviously breaking the rules.
Same! It sucks. When you’re just left all alone and they don’t respond back : (

> This is sort of counterproductive though. Most of the time, help isn't generalized, it's personalized by nature. 

Uh, no it isn't.  We're not suggesting anything so superficial as lurkers happening to read exactly what they need to hear said to someone else.  Observing truly supportive exchanges is good for everyone's mental health, and a great learning experience for those who want to help but aren't sure how.  

> Not everyone's depression look the same, some advice can trigger anxiety in others while it can be a wake-up call to some.  

Which is why we explicitly discourage advice.  

FYI chats have been tried here many, many times and all have ended in disaster.  We've been forced to conclude that it's not a fit for our population and can't support any further attempts.

It's always difficult (and worrying) when someone gets attached to a resource or individual that just isn't able to provide the right support.  It happens sometimes at my IRL crisis line, most often because they've never had a supportive conversation before they talked to us, so they kind of "imprint" on us (we literally call them "ducklings").  It can happen for other reasons too, and no mattter how it comes about, the end result is that they are convinced that "only X can help me" and also that "X has what I need", both of which are almost always untrue.  This happens all too often even when nobody creates unrealistic expectations or makes - or at least implies - impossible promises  - but "PM me anytime" does both those things.  

>  There is one guy who suffers from depression n a slew of undiagnosed issues who always private messages me to respond to my issues which really annoys me. It's complicated cause he has personality issues too.

One of the most difficult training issues at my agency is helping new responders set boundaries with people in crisis.  But it's absolutely necessary - maybe more necessary than with people *not* in crisis.  We harm people by *not* disrupting their unrealistic expectations that can never be met.  We also harm people when we try to give them what we simply haven't got.  So sometimes the best harm-reduction option is to say directly "I'm really sorry, but I can't give you what you're asking me for".   It can help to offer alternatives when we say that, even if they reject them in the moment.
Please help us by removing any rule-breaking responses. We catch as many as we can, but having any bad examples out there is a problem.

Not sure why you put this here, but from reading your history, it sounds like your current therapist isn't handling your disclosure of thoughts of suicide in a way that's helping you.  

This is, sadly, such a common problem that we have[this link](https://www.speakingofsuicide.com/2013/07/22/therapists-who-do-not-panic/) on our official resource list over at /r/SuicideWatch.

If someone is harassing you in PMs, please report that to the admins.

Exactly how to block and/or report someone depends on which app or client you're using.   In the official mobile apps, both are available by tapping the three dot menu in the top right corner of each message in your PM list.

You can report a PM to the sitewide admins by clicking "report" on it or going to https://www.reddit.com/report/ - don't post usernames of spammers, please! 

I appreciate your wanting to report it - trying to proselytize to people when they're struggling with depression is not in any way okay or helpful, really sorry that happened.

You're not conflating depression and suicidality, are you?

>Can you give me an example?

Sure, if the person is suffering from say a mix of diagnoses and is getting support from reddit for depression for his/hers self described situation, that can very easily turn badly if the patient in question is actually suffering from different types of mental health disorders and is currently self harming, that support can turn into support for those destructive tendencies.

​

Another example would be psychosis for example.

"Got myself into trouble"... Frankly, Take what you like & leave the rest:
It's more an issue of discretion...

I can write, in EXPLICIT detail about the events of my past AND my present. Further, from my own experience, I'm fully aware that some minors unfortunately go through vile & reprehensible things. For this LATTER cause, knowing there's NO age filter on this platform, I won't give ALL of the salacious details of the abuse which led to my suicidal ideations prior to age 6. So, my private message stated as such & I asked the age of the enquirer. (14 yrs old). I then informed them because of that,  I'd give some of the details, but not all of them. Then I stated I remembered well from my experience how difficult the teen years are & that I couldn't fix anything or advise, however if they wanted a safe place to vent, they had my ear.

As a moderator are you counseling I openly speak of the sexual use & abuse which fostered my want of self destruction regardless of the possible (likely) presence of minors?

Read the rules, report inappropriate content.  When someone seems well-meaning, kindly direct them to the rule they don't seem to be aware of.  For anything really flagrant, message our modmail.  

Do *not* encourage people who are *not* asking for support about depression *the mental illness*

1. "achievement" or "milestone" posts and encouraging people who make them are all outside our mission

2.  Any kind of bad life experience or situation (e.g. social injustice, lousy birthdays, bad breakups, any grief and loss) is *not* a mental illness.  Feeling bad for good reason is perfectly healthy.  So, again, all that's outside our mission and should be discouraged. 

Sort by new, look for people in distress who haven't received quality replies and empathise with them.  

Nice jaunty bow you have on your tail there :-)

So, wouldn't that be a risk everywhere on the internet, no matter what?  Not sure that's in our power to prevent.  Nor how you're claiming it would be ameliorated by private conversation with untrained peers where there's no community scrutiny.  

Didn't answer my question about depression versus suicidality, btw.

> As a moderator are you counseling I openly speak of the sexual use & abuse which fostered my want of self destruction regardless of the possible (likely) presence of minors?

Absolutely yes.  

First, that type of content is common here and we don't ask OPs in need of support to censor themselves.  Second, most of the minors who come here have experienced a fairly comparable level of trauma.

>So, wouldn't that be a risk everywhere on the internet, no matter what?

Yes, which was my point. 

​

> Nor how you're claiming it would be ameliorated by private conversation with untrained peers where there's no community scrutiny. 

Oh I don't. I think they're equal in their possibility to affect badly. But PMs probably open a different sets of difficulty from bad actors as well as depressed people generally having a bad effect on each other.

Last night I cried myself to sleep. I feel alone in this world. I don’t feel like I have anymore deep meaning relationships anymore. I can’t remember how it feels to be truly connected to someone. I don’t even know if I’ve ever had that. I feel like all my life has been a fight against my demons and now I am slowly letting them in. Life feels grim and hopeless.

I feel like I'm not a good enough person to ever break this unending cycle of depression, anxiety and trauma I've been in for the last decade and change. I don't think other people give much thought to me at all, but if they do they're probably disappointed with how I've turned out.

It's been horrible. Meds don't seem to faze me anymore, suicidal thoughts are back and I'm depriving myself of pretty much any social contact in the hopes people forget about me and I can pass without hurting them. I don't even wanna leave my room or get out of bed anymore. I've been gaining tons of weight, and wallowing in my own self-pity and lack of skills without actually fucking doing anything. Every day has become a complete struggle to go through and I almost pray every night for some deity to put me down because I'm dead weight on this world. I don't even want to get therapeutic help because it didn't do anything last time. Researching my meds I found out they're also used to treat schizophrenia and it's making me paranoid about my sanity. I just don't even know what to do anymore.

I can’t stop crying. I got an email critique that utterly devastated me and made me feel like I wasn’t making any process in my art at all. I haven’t cried this hard in years. It’s just all so overwhelming to me and I have no idea what to do next. The plan I had for myself to improve my portfolio in the beginning of the year feels like it just completely got derailed, and I feel helpless and foolish that I ever thought I had a good plan in the first place when I have no idea what I’m doing. 

Maybe it’s time to see a therapist again. I haven’t seen one for the past 2 years since I had to switch insurances but maybe it’s time to see one again.

Lately I took the effort to try and stop drinking. Managed to get into about 23-24 days of sobriety before relapsing recently. I feel kind of bad about it but I still want to get back on to try and stay off of it again. While alcohol may "numb" the pain of depression I know it will only worsen not only my depressive state but it would also severely affect my physical health as well. Not sure how this will play out but I genuinely want to find a way to get myself into a better place or headspace overall.

I am in so much emotional pain. All day I've been having crying fits. But when I cry it feels like it's not enough. Like it's not satisfying to express how deep the pain feels. I feel very lonely today like I'm the only person who exists on this planet type of loneliness. I wish someone could hold me and I could feel safe . I wish I wasn't in so much pain. I don't want to be in myself right now.

I want to die. I started cutting myself. I fucking hate it here. And I’m all alone. Literally I have absolutely no one. Everyone has better things to do and I respect it but it just sucks. I’m not a good person
I am way to old to be curled up in bed crying and wallowing in self pity but here I am…

This just never truly goes away now, does it? I find myself coming back to this place from time to time to talk about my mental health when it's spiraling out of control. It's weirdly comforting to know that there are people out there who understand. 

I've been neglecting my friends again. I don't know why I always sabotage perfectly fine friendships, why I cut people off entirely and disappear when I'm not doing well mentally. I just... Don't have the energy to reply to people? I really don't know. Maybe it's because I didn't want to be a downer so I just cut myself off entirely to prevent it? I don't even understand it myself. 

It took me a few months to reply to this friend of mine. I finally got the courage to apologize to him after ghosting him for a long time. "I'm so sorry I fell back into bad habits, I should've let you know that I was going through something instead of just disappearing" I'm so disappointed and angry at myself. Why am I like this. There are people I haven't talked to in years because I was suicidal back then. I still haven't gotten the courage to apologize, after all these years. I don't know. I wish I wasn't the way I am.

struggling so much today.

posted in an advice subreddit to ask about an interpersonal issue at work. got an automated message telling me it didn’t belong in that sub.

posted in the bpd sub to ask if anyone had suggestions for how to cope with the issue (because I know my bpd is affecting how I feel about it and how I’m dealing with it). got a message telling me it didn’t belong in that sub, either.

there’s really nowhere I can talk about what I’m going through. nobody I can tell.

unrelated, but I had to put my cat to sleep last week. I haven’t told a soul because I understand that nobody wants to hear it.

no one wants to put up with me. I don’t blame them. I want to disappear.
I really need to be more compassionate to others. I've been rude and hurting others lately because of my own shit but that doesn't mean I can't be good for others.

Does anyone else get random bursts of competency and a "I'll push through this" mindset for a few days then just crash back down? I've had so many of those in the past few months and now I'm looking at my room that's filled with new unused exercise equipment and nice clothes that still have tags on them. Now I just feel even worse looking at them.
today’s my birthday. it’s my least favorite day of the year. i always take off work because i just end up breaking down crying at some point. this time is no different.

spiraling tonight. my coworker is leaving for a better job, so her responsibilities will be assigned to me, on top of my current responsibilities. feeling trapped, inadequate and hopeless. every day is harder.

Here we go again. A bout of ugly crying and a tinge of hopelessness.

Why do I want to even get better? I can just fuck people up and drag down them with me, right.
i dont see a happy ending for myself. i feel like im wandering around without any direction. i feel so awful 24/7
Trying to stay away from any sort of dating. Trying to be ok on my own again. I just feel so lonely all the time and just so sad :(

I'm not okay.

I'm really struggling coming to terms with a lot of things.  It really distresses me that things are unresolved in personal relationships.  I'm distressed about things going on in my family.  I made a post about suicidal ideation yesterday but I deleted it.  I feel such a heavy weight on my shoulders and I question myself all the time.

I don't like who I am.  I am so bitter and angry.  It sucks all the energy out of me.  I am so resentful and hurt.  I feel like nobody cares and... it's so embarrassing being an adult and feeling like this.  It feels like this is something an angsty teenager would write, but it's how I feel.

I feel like when I talk or write to people it's wrong or they look at me like I'm crazy.  I'm not crazy.  I feel like there's elements going on that are out of order that I'm apart of and I desperately want to detach myself from it.

The only peace I get is when I sleep.  The trouble starts as soon as I walk out the door.

I've read a lot on this forum about people sleeping their lives off and while I have been depressed for more than 20 years is until now that I understand where they are coming from. I wake up, work, and lay in bed for the rest of the day. This past week I have slept for around 14 hours a day. I just don't have the energy anymore to improve or even sustain a functional lifestyle.

This is getting from bad to worse.
am i really depressed or am i just objectively bland pointless braindead and an asshole

Sometimes I feel I was deliberately engineered to suffer, my combination of genes, social skills and status, the environment I was born in and the people that molded me in the most critical years made me a perfect test subject which only purpose in life is to be in constant excruciating pain. Be it emotional, social, physical or psychological.

It is like I'm some kind of machine or algorithm that has to gather and process data about suffering and then die.

Can this nightmare end already, I already went through enough of this sadistic experiment.

I can't shake this feeling that I'm just spinning my wheels, that my best days are behind me, and not only did I not win the race, I didn't even finish and I'm heading to a lonely lonely future passing 40 years old, no wife, no kids, no job, no hope, everyone I grew up with became something special, someone special, had a life, had a dream, except for me. I'm so divorced from that reality I'd be like an alien from another world if they ever saw me again. What the fuck happened? How did I get here? It's like my life pulled up and did a drive-by shooting on me, and now I'm just a corpse watching an old vhs tape of a shitty life over and over everyday.

went to a coffee shop on my lunch break. the barista used to work with my sister and had heard about my grandma, who died suddenly last month.

she said, without prompting, “I’m so sorry about your grandma,” and I was honestly touched, because nobody else has told me that. nobody.

she then used my grandma’s death as a springboard to tell me about when she fell and cut her leg while hiking over the summer.

I feel like I only exist so other people can use me.

I legitimately have an addiction to youtube. I'm on it nearly 24 hours a day (that's what it feels like). I'm on the website or app from the moment I wake up to the moment I go to sleep. It's really bad. It's easy to say to just delete the app or block the website with an extension, and I've tried but my life just feels so empty and lifeless and boring without it, I can't stay off for long. It takes up so much time and distracts from getting stuff done. I think it'd help if I had something to replace it with, but I have nothing.
God please kill me tonight while I'm sleeping. Amen

I feel very defeated by this daytime tiredness. I wanted to be productive and be able to get some kind of work done, but time has passed and I've not been able to produce anything of value. Nearly everyday I feel this guilt or disgust with myself for not getting anything done. But I just can't think clearly enough to do anything. My mind is so foggy. DAE feel this guilt and struggle with motivation and energy?

I think about dying every day. I don’t think about suicide, just dying. It isn’t an unwelcome thought. I feel so trapped in my life. My workplace is small and most of my coworkers are bigoted, including my manager, so my complaints get brushed aside. I get talked over all the time at work and then they have the nerve to act as though I don’t contribute anything. 

I’m in constant but low level pain; it isn’t debilitating but it is always there. Surgery wouldn’t fix it because it isn’t severe enough for it but all the other things are bandaid solutions.

I want a cigarette so badly but I quit and I refuse to let all my problems in life win. 

My sister totaled my car and it’s a stressful mess. I have to clean up after her and it pisses me off. I got it two months ago and yeah it was used but now I need to get another one and it is so hard to find a good affordable car that doesn’t have over 100,000 miles on it. 

I have no energy. I leave my apartment well before work to stare at the ducks before I have to go into the office and stare at screens and sit in a chair that strains my injuries and listen to all the gossip from my coworkers. I hate that this is all there is. I could move to another office but I’m sure it’ll be much of the same.

It’s kinda sad that the best part if my day is when I’m walking to work in the morning with earbuds in listening to whatever music I want. I’m alone, it’s early so no one is really around, and I feel at peace. I don’t feel lonely when I do it. I feel so alone at home with my roommate and when I’m at work surrounded by people. I’ve never felt like I belonged anywhere except when I’m by myself.
i dont want to leave my bed, i dont want to go to work, i hate myself, and i want to die

I can't fucking so this anymore I just wanna die i hate my life. It's pretty much over anyway. I have no where to go and nothing to do after I graduate. I don't have any skills that are actually useful. My talents only help me make funny silly things and my social anxiety makes any career of that sort impossible. What's the point if doing anything anymore? School is making me unhappy, why keep going? I'm only here for the social aspect and I'm barely taking advantage of if. I still don't have a girlfriend. I never will cuz nobody wants to date an awkward unstable weirdo with 3 mental illnesses and intense fear of intimacy or vulnerability. I just want someone who cares about me. Someone who actually legitimately cares about me. Someone who wants to talk to me so I don't feel completely useless. I just want to hug someone or have someone actually care when I'm upset. Nobody actually cares about me. I'm nothing. After I graduate I might as well just fucking kill myself cuz my life will be over. Idk what to do, i have to make major decisions soon but Idk what to do about any of them. I cannot fucking stand living with a couple anymore but I have nowhere else to go and nobody else to live with. I basically have 8 months to live. I want to take advantage of it but I know I won't be able to cuz my brain wants me to fail. I'm just so lonely, if there was one person that I could spend time with that could make life feel like it's worth living Idk I shouldn't rely on another person but that's all I need. Companionship, I'm too weird and stupid and awkward. I can barely talk to people anymore. Takibg a new med and as usual experiencing all the awful side effects. It's no use. I've tried dozens of meds at this point. I'll never get better I'll never function I'll never ever be a person worth existing, . my lack of a purpose is all i have. Fuck I just can't i hate myself so much why can't i just have a happy life god fucking family no just wanna fumxing die)

read a conversation on a sub for therapists that boiled down to: "mentally ill people can't usually keep a job, and the ones who can usually have an illness that's mild and easily medicated."

this mindset is exactly why I can't get help.

no doctor or therapist has ever believed that I'm depressed, because I have a demanding job -- and if I'm performing consistently at work, that must mean I'm fine.

it feels unfair.

Sighs. I am crying rn. I had 2 rough days. 

And also made a mistake and became akin to Satan. 

I tried apologising & to fix it. Apparently I am not worth it. 

Fuck my life. 

Its almost my birthday. Man, I wish I could die on that day. So ironic. Bitch of a life.

Work is miserable today. 
I feel like I'm either missing something or things are suddenly dropping on me. 
Trying to look at the big picture but it hurts to keep going today.
Been depressed since I was 13. Almost 53 now and I can’t go any farther. My life is a mess and I can’t fight anymore.

I am really worried about my teeth, going to the dentist hopefully will have any worries resolved. I find myself grieving times when I was happy that I don't think can ever happen again. I go back and reminisce on those times involuntarily to the point that I'm not even in this timeline, I am pulled back to the early 2010s again and again, the time when I feel I was the happiest I'd ever been. I keep romanticizing that time knowing full well it wasn't perfect, I was still dealing with a lot of problems then. They just weren't as glaringly obvious. My problems were just beginning to blossom back then, under the top layer of exhilarating "finding myself" in college, socializing, making art, there was still a lot of pain and serious problems I wasn't taking care of. They hadn't impacted my health  or bank account yet. But it had always been there.

Things are progressively getting worse. I haven’t had a day as bad as today in years. I’ve made it my goal to find a therapist by the end of the week. I’m sick of dealing with this much hurt every day.
one die, please
every day gets worse and worse. cant even have the energy to formulate coherent words anymore. yeah im functioning in my day to day life but still feel so empty.

If you want me dead God, just strike me down and get it over with. Otherwise I’m going to war on this hell. Fucking misery. I’ll live just to spit in the face of the odds. 3 good people I know killed themselves. Another one is slowly killing themselves, and I had to sit by and watch. Fuck you reality. You can’t kill or break me. YOU CANT KILL ME

I thought I was doing better, last semester I had the worst semester long break down I think I’ve ever experienced. I almost did the thing twice, the thought of my parents stopped me both times. Over summer I was purely working on myself and getting comfortable with myself and such. This semester has been great so far but I’ve noticed some issues, depressive episodes on and off during the day sometimes at night and I’ve gotten drunk a couple of times and was told that I worried my roommates bc they saw what was really behind my smile, how sad I really am, how depressed I am. Just yesterday it took me saying “I am not stable” out loud to realize that I am not as stable as I thought. I feel lost, empty, hollow and I don’t feel comfortable in my own skin. I was diagnosed with depression as a teenager years ago, not a candidate for medication as it conflicts with other medication I take that is medically necessary. I’m exhausted all the time, and have no motivation left for anything. I’ve been having a par toculatly hard time with my depression the last few months, and Then I got hit with some really crappy news this week.

I live in a lot of physical pain, have for over a decade. I made my peace with that, it didn’t contribute to my depression. But now, I have a new condition, that my doctor says will never go away, never get better, only grown worse. My insides hurt all the time. I’d figured out how to live with my other chronic pain issues, but this is somehow so different.
I just want one part of my body not to hurt. The diagnosis has crippled my already shockingly poor mental health, and I’ve lost the will to live entirely. I can’t do any of the things I enjoy, and I’m now terrified my boyfriend will leave me, and he’d have every right to do so. He didn’t sign up for this. He wants kids, and I can’t have them let alone raise them or mother then. I don’t even know how to tell him yet. I just got the diagnosis this week. Why would he possibly want me once he knows? I know it’s selfish, but I feel like I need time to process my grief myself before I speak to him, tell him our entire life plan is out the window, and I’m no longer what he wanted.
Hell, I probably won’t even be able to have sex soon. I’m getting more depressed and harder to be around. I feel like no matter how hard I try, I’m a colder, crueller person. I rarely make jokes anymore. I miss who I used to be. I feel like I’m grieving for my own death.

I get criticized for keeping my thoughts and feelings to myself, and not opening up or sharing and when I do, I can’t actually talk to anyone about it, because they either worry over something they can’t fix, or tell me that my life is too sad or too depressing or they ‘can’t handle it’.

One of my good friends committed suicide a while ago. I miss her, and a lot of things are reminding me of her lately. I hope her pain is gone now. I know it’s selfish, but I wish she was still here. She was one of the best people I’ve ever known.

I have a dog who I could not live without, and I worry that when she’s gone, I’ll lose my last reason to stay here. She got me through my worst months of depression, my suicidal thoughts a few years ago, and she continues to get me through the worst days. I just want something. To get better. Anything really.


I appreciate having this space to vent about bad days, months, years. To vent About depression to people who understand what it’s like. To rant about how crippling depression itself can be, and how much harder it makes a bad day.  I hope all of you find some peace, relief, or joy in something. I hope your pain eases soon, and that you have better days ahead of you.

> I've seen a lot of messages about committing suicide in here.

We encourage people who are mainly seeking support related to suicidal thoughts or intent to post over in /r/SuicideWatch rather than here - [suicidality is actually a separate phenomenon from depression](https://www.reddit.com/r/depression/wiki/what_is_depression#wiki_suicidality), even though it's not uncommon for people to experience both at the same time. 

That said, since depression and suicidality *do* occur together for many people, taking down every post that mentions suicidality wouldn't make sense here either. 

> It concerns me because this place shouldn't be for goodbye notes and declarations like that. This can be like an invitation for others to write their suicide note.

Most people who post about even immediate-sounding intent don't go on to die by suicide - often it's the only way they feel able to reach out for support when they're in crisis. Seeing that other struggle with suicidal thoughts isn't, in and of itself, a factor for suicide risk - in fact, feeling less alone with suicidality can decrease a sense of alienation, which is one of the major risk factors for suicidality. 

While SW is the better place for posting suicidal thoughts/intent specifically, how people express their struggles is not as much a concern to us as how commenters respond - we encourage people to write thoughtful, individualized responses, and avoid responses that aren't responsive to the OP's experience and needs, general uplifting messages, prescribing and incitement (rules 2, 4-8), as all of those are things that *are* known to increase risk and generally make people feel worse. 

If you see any content of that nature on *any* post here, whether it mentions suicidality or not, please do report it so we can deal.

It's been 2 years, 10 days ago.. It gets better, and it gets worse along the way.. I guess you just learn to live with it.. One thing that helped me with the grief was an explanation I've read sometime in the aftermath. I'm paraphrasing - 'at the beginning it's the end of the world, because it literally is. the person you've lost was your whole life. Most of your experiences were in relation to that person. In order to get a little release from the grief, one should not try to hide it or make it smaller. Instead it should grow around it. Live with it. It does not get easier.. Grief does not get smaller.. It's still here, same as the first day you experienced it.. It just becomes a smaller part of your life as time goes on..'

​

Here's a similar illustration, but I like to think of the circles getting bigger, and the grief staying the same size: [https://aftertheheartbreak.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/My-Stages-of-Grief.jpg](https://aftertheheartbreak.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/My-Stages-of-Grief.jpg)

The most important thing is listening and trying to help them sort through the issues that have led them to that point. Don’t try to fix it or contradict; perception is reality and their feelings are real to them. If possible, ask them to agree to keep safe until they can get help. The best thing to offer is your ear and your shoulder to cry on. If you’re concerned that an attempt is immanent, it’s ok to contact emergency services for a welfare check: never put yourself in a dangerous situation, and don’t take personal responsibility for their mental health onto yourself. But remember, the decision of suicide is ultimately their decision. You can say or do absolutely everything “right” and they may still decide to follow through. It doesn’t mean you failed, or you were a bad friend/relative. If you want to get some decent training, look into a suicide first aid course like ASIST or Safetalk. They offer lots of great skills that can, hopefully, help you talk someone through their crisis point and get them to the help that they need.

Here also. Go go go..collapse into uselessness.  I do better when I create structure. I know I do better. It works for a long time, cognitive behavioral therapy.  I put my angry moments into my "book of petty grievances" and gratitude and general journal in another book. And schedule time for me in a third book.  And I'm ok. Good even..for a long while. 

Then I feel so sick of rules everywhere.  Why do I have to follow all these rules? Fuck the rules and fuck the rulekeepers. [Which are also me]. And I rebel, go wild. Or I get too busy and work too long and I'm tired. And then I fall apart and struggle to close the cupboards because it's so exhausting after getting a cup out. And put things down instead of away, classic way to make my space a disaster quickly. Then its hard to get up, and too messy to think.

Then I start it a over again. We can't function in this mess, let's clean up! Etc.

I think that’s the biggest problem with depression and even if we decide to start considering exit options - we’re always guilted with burdening and causing grief to others. Nobody else lives through the pain and misery of the suffering person’s life, why do other’s get to decide what’s best for them? In your case, I’m not going to patronize you and tell you what you should do to alleviate your pain, but just remember that it’s your struggle and it’s very real. Put yourself first and don’t worry about the burdens others may feel - that’s their baggage. I hope you are able to get some relief soon.
